j713.text:
In this section, we are going to see how to make a simple recolor of the spinner for games that normally have different color dice.

 The two properties that we are going to use at this stage are "valueCSS" for changing the central value colors and "backgroundCSS" for customizing the options area. For changing the arrow SVG or adding or completely changing the options area there is an advanced customization section.

  For "valueCSS" the two most useful properties are "background-color" for changing the main color and "color" for changing the font color.

  The "backgroundCSS" is a bit misleading as one would imagine that the options could be customized with simple CSS. This is not the case as the options are actually in an SVG image. For a simple customization the "backgroundCSS" can be used for changing the white background and adding a colored border. 

  On the variant notes you can find documentation for all the CSS properties used in this tutorial.

info.name: Spinners
info.attribution:

4nl9.text: !important is used to force a CSS property when there is already a preset for it. Try using it whenever a CSS property is not applied.
